description: From Middle French inane, from Latin inānis (“empty, vain, useless”) which is of unknown origin.

adjectives.description: inane (comparative inaner or more inane, superlative inanest or most inane)

entries.meaning: Lacking sense or meaning (often to the point of boredom or annoyance)
examples: This supremely gifted kid told me that in the early elementary grades, the songs sung in music class were so inane that he wanted to skip grades already! Eventually he did, so better late than never.

entries.meaning: That which is void or empty.
examples: [...] whom we watch as we watch the clouds careering in the windy, bottomless inane, or read about like characters in ancient and rather fabulous annals.
